docs.snippet: Here are a few baseline numbers to compare what is about to unfold this year with past World Cups.
docs.lead_paragraph: If you are anything like me, knowing your World Cup history is tricky. I happily remember my favorite moments, and try to forget moments of absolute dread. And when it comes to the details, I easily get into friendly debates about past tournaments because my memory isn't what is used to be (or probably never was).
docs.abstract: Here are a few baseline numbers to compare what is about to unfold this year with past World Cups.

headline.main: World Cup History by the Numbers

docs.snippet: The United States team is eager to get the World Cup started.
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States team is tired. It's not a question of fitness -- the strength and conditioning coach Pierre Barrieu has been praised by the coach and players all week. But there is a sort of fatigue setting in.
docs.abstract: The United States team is eager to get the World Cup started.

docs.snippet: Brazil and Portugal are heavy favorites to qualify for the knockout round. But Ivory Coast boasts some of the most talented attacking players in the game.
docs.lead_paragraph: At the 1986 World Cup in Mexico, Uruguay Coach Omar Borras characterized his team's draw - West Germany, Denmark and Scotland - as the "group of death."
